Detailed Description

Functions related to the help browser.

The help data is in helpfile.h

Function Documentation

void Button_Help ( void   ) 

Called to open the help window with the keyboard shortcut.

If the mouse is over a button, its contextual help will be displayed. Else, the default helpscreen will be shown.

References Button_under_mouse(), Key, and Window_help().

Referenced by Init_buttons().

Referenced by Init_buttons().

void Window_help ( int  section,
const char *  sub_section 
)

Displays and runs the "Help / About..." window.

Parameters:
section Number of the help section page to display (equals the button number the mouse was hovering for the contextual help), -1 for the main help page.
sub_section Help sub-section title (the page will be scrolled so this title is at the top).

References Block, BUTTON_HELP, Close_window(), Compute_slider_cursor_height(), Current_help_section, Display_cursor(), Display_help(), Help_position, Help_section, Hide_cursor, Is_shortcut(), Key, KEY_ESC, KEY_MOUSEWHEELDOWN, KEY_MOUSEWHEELUP, T_Help_section::Length, MC_Black, Menu_factor_X, Menu_factor_Y, Mouse_Y, T_Scroller_button::Nb_elements, Open_window(), T_Scroller_button::Position, Scroll_help(), Unselect_button(), Update_rect(), Wait_end_of_click(), Window_attribute2, Window_clicked_button(), Window_display_frame_in(), Window_draw_slider(), Window_pos_X, Window_pos_Y, Window_set_normal_button(), Window_set_scroller_button(), Window_set_shortcut(), and Window_set_special_button().
